YokeÔÉÅ

class pyrit.toolbox.geolibrary.Yoke(name: str = '', origin_x: float = 0, origin_y: float = 0, origin_z: float = 0, anchor: Union[BasicAnchor, Tuple[float]] = BasicAnchor.WEST, width: float = 1.0, height: float = 2.0, thickness: float = 0.1, thickness_bot: Optional[float] = None, thickness_top: Optional[float] = None, thickness_outer: Optional[float] = None, thickness_inner: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius: float = 0, corner_radius_inside: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius_outside: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius_inside_bot_inner: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius_inside_bot_outer: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius_inside_top_inner: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius_inside_top_outer: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius_outside_bot: Optional[float] = None, corner_radius_outside_top: Optional[float] = None, air_gap_thickness: float = 0.05, air_gap_pos: float = 0.5, mesh_size: Optional[float] = None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Geo

Model of a Yoke with or without air gap in 2D. Meant for axialsymmetric geometries.

Examples

The easiest way to create this model is by

>>> model = Yoke('yoke')

This can then be used with the geometry module

>>> from pyrit.geometry.Geometry import Geometry
>>> geo = Geometry('yoke', show_gui=True)
>>> with geo.geometry():
>>>     model.add_to_gmsh()

The parameters can be passed to the model with the kwargs:

>>> model = Yoke('foil_winding', width=1.3, air_gap_pos=0.4)
>>> model.corner_radius_inside = 0.05
>>> model.corner_radius_outside_bot = 0.1

Constructor

Parameters

  • name (str) ‚Äì Name of the Geo

  • origin_x (float, optional) ‚Äì The x-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

  • origin_y (float, optional) ‚Äì The y-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

  • origin_z (float, optional) ‚Äì The z-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

name: str = ''ÔÉÅ

Name of the foil winding

origin_x: float = 0ÔÉÅ

x-coordinate of the origin

origin_y: float = 0ÔÉÅ

y-coordinate of the origin

origin_z: float = 0ÔÉÅ

z-coordinate of the origin

anchor: Union[BasicAnchor, Tuple[float]] = (0, 0.5)ÔÉÅ

Anchor of the foil winding.

width: float = 1.0ÔÉÅ

The width of the yoke (x direction).

height: float = 2.0ÔÉÅ

The height of the yoke (y direction).

thickness: float = 0.1ÔÉÅ

The thickness of the yoke. This is the default value that is used if the specific thicknesses for the sides (top, bot, inner, outer) are set to None.

thickness_bot: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Thickness at the bottom side.

thickness_top: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Thickness at the top side.

thickness_outer: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Thickness at the outside, i.e. the right side.

thickness_inner: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Thickness in the middle, i.e. left side.

corner_radius: float = 0ÔÉÅ

The default value for the corner radius. It is used if corner_radius_inside or corner_radius_outside is set to None. The corner radius can be 0. Then there is a sharp corner

corner_radius_inside: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the inside corners. Used if a specific inner corner radius is set to None.

corner_radius_outside: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the outside corners. Used if a specific inner corner radius is set to None.

corner_radius_inside_bot_inner: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the inner (i.e. left) bottom corner at the inside.

corner_radius_inside_bot_outer: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the outer (i.e. right) bottom corner at the inside.

corner_radius_inside_top_inner: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the inner (i.e. left) top corner at the inside.

corner_radius_inside_top_outer: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the outer (i.e. right) top corner at the inside.

corner_radius_outside_bot: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the bottom corner at the outside.

corner_radius_outside_top: float = NoneÔÉÅ

Corner radius for the top corner at the outside.

air_gap_thickness: float = 0.05ÔÉÅ

The Thickness of the air gap.

air_gap_pos: float = 0.5ÔÉÅ

The position of the air gap. The middle of the air gap lies at air_gap_pos of the height. So with air_gap_pos=0.7 the air gap is at 70% of the height of the yoke.

mesh_size: float = NoneÔÉÅ

The mesh size for gmsh. This is the default mesh size taken for all points that are generated.

determine_coordinates(anchor: Union[BasicAnchor, Tuple[float]]) → ndarrayÔÉÅ

Computes the coordinates of an anchor.

Parameters

anchor (Union[Anchor, Tuple[float]]) ‚Äì An anchor or tuple of the relative coordinates. (0,0) is the south-west corner (1,1) is the north-east corner.

Returns

coordinates ‚Äì The coordinates of the anchor.

Return type

np.ndarray

add_to_gmsh(**kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Adds the Entities of the Geo to gmsh.

When this method is called, gmsh needs to be initialized. So at least

gmsh.initialize(sys.argv)

has to be called beforehand. However, it is recommended to use the context manager Geometry from the class Geometry.

property inner_lines: List[Line]ÔÉÅ

List of the lines at the inside of the yoke.

property outer_lines: List[Line]ÔÉÅ

List of lines at the outside of the yoke. Lines on the axis (i.e. left side) are not in this list.

property axis_linesÔÉÅ

List of lines at the axis (i.e. left side).
